summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) discussing a request from FBI Florida to obtain consent to share grand jury materials from the original Epstein case. The email addresses procedural questions about coordination with the Southern District of Florida (SDLF) and the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG).

persons.name: Lisa
persons.context: Mentioned as having previously contacted the criminal chief of the Southern District of Florida regarding the Epstein case.

events.title: Email Coordination on Grand Jury Materials
events.description: Internal email within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York discussing FBI Florida's request to obtain consent from the Southern District of Florida to share grand jury materials from the original Epstein case.

keyFacts: FBI Florida requested consent from the Southern District of Florida (SDLF) to share grand jury materials from the original Epstein case with the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
SDNY had previously obtained some files without raising the consent issue, but FBI Florida now requires formal consent.
Sharing grand jury material between different federal grand juries is permitted under Rule 6(e) and has been done before with a letter acknowledgement.
The email raises a procedural question about whether to contact the criminal chief of SDLF directly or have the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) coordinate the request.
